us.title: Strategist: 'Wishful thinking' to expect a rebound for U.S. stocks in the second half of 2025
us.content: Peter Berezin of BCA Research is calling for a recession as the U.S. consumer outlook weakens. He is also worried about budget negotiations as Trump could push through un-funded tax cuts, which will push up bond yields.

us.title: The US will see monetary inflation in the next few years unless the Fed realizes this, expert warns
us.content: 'Kudlow' panelists Steve Forbes, Art Laffer and Steve Moore discuss growing the economy and responding to inflation. #inflation #foxbusiness

us.title: Investors Brush Off Extreme Recession Sentiment
us.content: Negative economic sentiment is at levels typically seen in wartime, explains Denise Chisholm, director of quantitative market strategy at Fidelity Investments. She discusses what historical data suggests about potential market opportunity with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Technology.

us.content: CNBC's Frank Holland shares latest on CFO Council Survey.

us.title: Ripple Scores Major Win as SEC Agrees to Return $75M from XRP Fine
us.content: Ripple Labs appears to be nearing the end of its years-long legal battle with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), emerging with a significant victory. Ripples Chief Legal Officer, Stuart Alderoty, announced via X that the SEC will return $75 million of the $125 million fine Ripple paid last year.

us.title: We're not witnessing a typical private sector capex boom, says Jim Cramer
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer gives his take on capex spending and whether the market is in the middle of a boom or bubble.

us.title: Jim Cramer talks the bull and bear cases for the data center buildout thesis
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer gives his take on capex spending in the data sector and whether the market is in the middle of a boom or bubble.

us.title: 'Fast Money' traders discuss if the consumer could be the canary in the coal mine for the economy
us.content: 'Fast Money' traders discuss if the consumer could be the canary in the coal mine for the economy.

us.title: Real estate stocks: Analyst talks small and mid-cap plays to consider
us.content: Sales of new US single-family homes saw a slight increase in February, indicating that some homebuyers are returning to the market. Wedbush Securities senior vice president of equity research Jay McCanless joins Market Domination hosts Josh Lipton and Julie Hyman to share his insights on positioning oneself within the housing sector amid challenges like rising lumber prices and shifting consumer confidence.

us.title: Nintendo Shares Rise on Hopes for Switch 2 Console
us.content: Nintendo's shares rose sharply amid hopes for its upcoming Switch 2 console, the new version of its widely successful Switch console that was launched in 2017.

us.title: Calamos Attracts $100M with Bitcoin Funds, But ETH and Meme Coins Not on the Radar
us.content: Global asset manager Calamos Investments, overseeing $41.3 billion in assets, made its crypto debut this year with the launch of three bitcoin-focused funds. Designed to shield investors from Bitcoin (BTC) volatility, these structured ETFs have already attracted over $100 million, largely from financial advisors.

us.title: Dogecoin Struggles Below Key Resistance as Market Awaits Clear Breakout
us.content: Dogecoin (DOGE) remains stuck below a critical resistance level, struggling to confirm a breakout while most major cryptocurrencies push higher. Currently trading at $0.18 with a modest 1.76% intraday gain, DOGE lingers beneath the 26-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA)a crucial technical barrier often signaling early trend reversals.

france.title: SoFi Technologies: Don't Overthink It - Accumulate More While You Still Can
france.content: We initially rated SoFi Technologies a 'Strong Buy' in August due to its strong offerings, member growth, and attractive valuation. The stock surged over 175% at its peak, but recently dropped 40% due to market-wide sell-offs triggered by Trump tariff fears. Despite the drawdown, we remain very bullish on SOFI, based on the company's continued growth and long-term bottom-line prospects.

france.title: Walmart: A Needed Correction, Growth And Margin Stories Intact Amid Macro Jitters
france.content: Fears of a consumer slowdown have impacted the retail sector, with Walmart shares down nearly 20% from their pre-earnings high. Despite solid Q4 results and strong eCommerce growth, WMT's valuation appears stretched, leading to a hold rating. Key risks include macroeconomic factors, consumer spending slowdown, and competitive pressures, which could impact margins and advertising revenue.

france.title: Primerica Household Budget Index™: Uncertainty Continues to Increase for Middle-Income Families Over Rising Cost of Necessities and Leveling of Income Growth
france.content: DULUTH, Ga.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--The latest Primerica Household Budget Index™ (HBI™), a monthly economic snapshot measuring the impact of inflation on middle-income households alongside their earned income, found the average purchasing power for necessities fell to 99.4% in February, a 0.3% decrease from a month ago but a 0.4% increase from a year ago. For households earning an annual income of around $60,000, the increase in necessity goods prices in February cost them about $110 more in total th.

france.title: Market volatility offers investors an opportunity to buy equities at a value
france.content: Consumer confidence dropped to the lowest level in four years. James Ragan, D.A.

france.title: McCormick Posts Q1 Earnings Miss, But Full-Year Outlook Holds Firm
france.content:
McCormick (NYSE:MKC) announced its first-quarter earnings, which fell short of Wall Street expectations, despite revenue meeting forecasts and guidance remaining unchanged.

For the quarter, the spice and flavoring maker reported adjusted earnings per share of $0.60, below the $0.64 consensus estimate. Revenue held steady at $1.61 billion, matching expectations but reflecting flat year-over-year growth.

The company’s 2% increase in sales volume was offset by a 2% foreign currency headwind, keeping overall top-line growth neutral. McCormick’s Consumer segment saw a 1% rise in organic sales, while Flavor Solutions posted 3% organic growth, signaling steady demand across its core business units.

Despite the soft Q1 earnings, McCormick reaffirmed its full-year guidance, expecting adjusted EPS in the range of $3.03 to $3.08, closely aligned with the $3.07 consensus. The company also maintained its projection of 1–3% organic sales growth for fiscal 2025.

france.title: Marathon Petroleum: Unique Financial Position (Rating Upgrade)
france.content: Marathon generates an ex-ordinary amount of cash. In a short period of time, the company could pay off its debt and repurchase a large portion of the stock to leave a very large amount of cash unused. Its partner, MPLX, now pays for the dividend and basic capital, leaving the balance of the cash free for use elsewhere.

france.title: Bitcoin Giant Strategy (MSTR) Outperforms BTC in 2025 with Smart Capital Moves
france.content: Strategy (NASDAQ: MSTR), formerly MicroStrategy, continues to lead as the top equity pick for investors seeking Bitcoin exposure, according to Compass Point Research. The firm praised Strategys strategic capital raises and disciplined approach to accumulating Bitcoin, despite ongoing market volatility.

france.title: Bitcoin Steadies Near $88K Amid Mt. Gox Transfers and ETF Momentum
france.content: Bitcoin traded around $88,000 on Tuesday, holding recent gains fueled by optimism over U.S. trade policy and large Bitcoin transfers by defunct exchange Mt. Gox. The worlds top cryptocurrency edged 0.1% lower to $88,167.5 by 5:00 p.m.

france.title: First Bank-Issued Stablecoin Launches on Ethereum, Boosting Institutional Adoption
france.content: Despite Ethereums recent price stagnation, institutional interest in its network remains strong. On March 25, Custodia Bank and Vantage Bank launched the first-ever U.S. bank-issued stablecoin on a public blockchainEthereum.
